heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.5°C) and outside temperature (down 2.0°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 128 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4524 lux), feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 360 m), and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 127.6m higher than yesterday, 80.7m lower than the past week, 359.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 926m and a high of 1357m, averaging 1212.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
